Bash(gh pr create --title "feat: polish UI first impressions and recovery UX" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary

Conducted a reality check on the UI and prioritized **first impressions and recovery UX** over planned roadmap items. These are the moments that determine whether users trust and enjoy the product.

### Welcome State (Ask Page)
- Replace generic "Ask B.O.B anything" with inviting "What would you like to know?"
- Add feature hints explaining key capabilities (search, click-to-source, local-first)
- Show dynamic stats (indexed documents/projects count)
- Add keyboard hints (/ to focus, Enter to search)
- Include empty state with direct link to indexing for new users

### Not Found State
- Replace bullet list with actionable cards
- Each card has icon, heading, explanation, and action button
- Direct links to Library (browse) and Indexing (add content)
- Cleaner visual hierarchy with clear next steps

### Error State
- Add recovery actions (Reload page, Check system health)
- Improved error message styling with monospace font
- Less alarming visual treatment

### Loading Experience
- Add animated loading spinner with "Searching your documents..." text
- Show loading state immediately when query is submitted

### Citation Interactivity
- Add pulse-highlight animation when clicking inline citations
- Source card briefly scales and glows to draw attention
- Smooth scroll to highlighted source

### Copy Improvements
- Routines page: Replace technical jargon with user-friendly language
- Simplified descriptions throughout

## Test plan

- [ ] Open Ask page and verify welcome state shows feature hints and stats
- [ ] Submit a query and verify loading spinner appears
- [ ] Click an inline citation [1] and verify source card highlights
- [ ] Search for something not in the index and verify actionable recovery cards
- [ ] Trigger an error and verify recovery buttons work
- [ ] Navigate to Routines and verify simplified copy
